intro: Daviesia benthamii, commonly known as the pink Daviesia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its distinctive pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sclerophyllous forests, preferring well-drained soils. It has narrow, evergreen leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Daviesia benthamii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
